data.title: Celebrities and Famous People in the Turks and Caicos
data.meta_description: Find out the extensive number of celebrities, historical figures and other famous people who have visited the Turks and Caicos.
data.text:
As a very small country that relatively few have heard of, the Turks and Caicos has seen quite an impressive number of famous visitors, from both present and past eras.

Today, the unparalleled beaches in the Turks and Caicos Islands attract people from across the globe, and there’s a wide range of luxury accommodation choices to stay at.

The exclusive all-inclusive resorts on Providenciales, Parrot Cay, and Pine Cay are favorites with the rich and famous, yet the expansive private rental mansions have also become popular as well.

As every beach in the Turks and Caicos is public and free-to-access up to the high tide point, regardless of whether the coast is on a private island or not, it’s possible to visit almost any location mentioned on this page.

Historic Arrivals

Along with being a possible site of Christopher Columbus’s first point of landfall in the Americas and New World, quite a few other interesting (albeit perhaps not globally significant!) historical events involving important people took place in and around the Turks and Caicos Islands.

Christopher Columbus

Date: 1492

Grand Turk is one of the three likely possible points of first landfall of Christopher Columbus’s historic voyage to the New World.

Ponce De Leon

Date: 1512

Spanish conquistador Ponce De Leon, then governor of Puerto Rico, received a royal charter from the Spanish Court which encouraged him to search for Bimini and the Fountain of Youth. Presumably on his way to discover what eventually became Florida, he anchored at an unknown location in our archipelago.

Captain John White

Date: 1587

English artist and explorer Captain John White stopped on West Caicos during the journey to Roanoke Island in Virginia. According to his accounts, he was expecting to gather the salt that would naturally occur in the shallow ponds, yet did not. Instead, his crew hunted “swanees” (probably flamingos!)

François l'Olonnais

Date: Later 1600s

French pirate François l'Olonnais was known to have operated off of French Cay and West Caicos. The origins of the Turks and Caicos name is derived from the islands being a pirate base.

Anne Bonney and Mary Reed

Date: Early 1700s

During a wilder time of Turks and Caicos history, the islands between Providenciales and North Caicos supported pirate bases due to their freshwater sources. In fact, what is now Parrot Cay used to be known as Pirate Cay because of the buccaneers. Famous female pirates Anne Bonney and Mary Reed were known to have operated from the island.

Horatio Nelson

Date: 1783

Horatio Nelson, the famed British naval commander, suffered one of his few defeats when he attempted to retake Fire Hill (near the current cruise center) from the French during the Battle of Grand Turk.

Theodoor Hendrik Nikolaas de Booy

Date: 1911

Dutch-American anthropologist and noted authority on the Caribbean peoples Theodoor de Booy spent a bit of time in the Caicos Islands searching the land and caves for evidence and artifacts from the Taino people. The result from these efforts was a book: Lucayan Remains on the Caicos Islands, possibly the first published book centered on the country.

Prince George

Date: 1928

Prince George, Duke of Kent, visited Grand Turk aboard the Royal Navy D-Class Light Cruiser HMS Durban during a relief mission after the major 1928 Hurricane (referred to as the Hurricane of the Century). He went ashore incognito.

Princess Margaret

Date: 1960

Princess Margaret Rose of the United Kingdom, Countess of Snowdon, paid an official visit to Grand Turk on the HMS Britannia. On the visit, she stopped at the two U.S. bases on the island: NAVFAC and South Base.

© NASA

John Glenn

Date: 1962

The first landfall of American astronaut John Glenn after the historic Mercury space mission was the island of Grand Turk. Today, a monument commemorating the incredible event can be seen at the Grand Turk Cruise Center.

Lyndon B Johnson

Date: 1962

In 1962, then U.S. vice president Lyndon B Johnson greeted John Glenn on Grand Turk after the astronaut’s historic mission.

© Joel Rouse / Ministry of Defense

H.M. Queen Elizabeth II

Date: 1966

Queen Elizabeth II visited South Caicos in 1966 aboard the HMS Royal Britannia. To commemorate the visit, the South Caicos Regatta has been held ever since.

© Allan Warren / CC BY-SA 3.0

Duke of Edinburgh

Date: 1966

Prince Philip, the Duke of Edinburgh, accompanied Queen Elizabeth II on her visit to South Caicos.

© Arnaud Bouissou

King Charles III

Date: 1973

King Charles III (then Prince Charles) of the United Kingdom stopped over at Grand Turk on the HMS Minerva. During his stay, he took part in local cricket matches as a member of the ship’s team. The ship’s crew also conducted community service and took the island’s Series Land Rover ambulance to the local hospital to repair and paint!

© Northern Ireland Office / CC BY 2.0

Prince Andrew

Date: 2000

Prince Andrew, Duke of York, made an official visit to the Turks and Caicos and stopped on both Grand Turk and Providenciales.

Grace Bay and Providenciales

Grace Bay Beach, the hallmark of the Turks and Caicos, is world renowned for its pristine sand and turquoise water. Luxury hotels and all-inclusive resorts line this breathtaking beach, and there’s a wonderful selection of water sports and things to do.

© Oli Gill / CC BY-SA 2.0

Paul McCartney

Several visits

Paul McCartney of the Beatles visited the Turks and Caicos by yacht and anchored off of Grace Bay.

© John Harrison / CC BY-SA 3.0

Christopher Walken

Date: 2002 and 2014

Actor Christopher Walken starred in two films shot in the Turks and Caicos: 2002 Life’s a Beach and the 2014 Turks and Caicos.

© University of Houston

Kenny Rogers

Date: 2007

Singer and songwriter Kenny Rogers performed in Turtle Cove on Providenciales during the now-defunct Turks and Caicos Music Festival.

© ultra 5280 / CC BY-SA 2.0

India Arie

Date: 2007

Grammy-winning R&B artist India Arie (now India Arie Simpson) performed at the 2007 Turks and Caicos Music Festival in Turtle Cove.

© John Mathew Smith & www.celebrity-photos.com / CC BY-SA 2.0

Michael Bolton

Date: 2007

This rock-turned-pop ballad singer was part of the star-studded lineup of musical artists who performed at the 2007 Turks and Caicos Music Festival on Providenciales.

© Eva Rinaldi / CC BY-SA 2.0

Alicia Keys

Date: 2007

Alicia Keys also performed at the 2007 Turks and Caicos Music Festival and went horseback riding with a local stable.

© Tatiana / CC BY-SA 2.0

Maria Sharapova

Date: 2006

Tennis star Maria Sharapova stayed at the Grace Bay Club on the unparalleled Grace Bay Beach, and modeled for Sports Illustrated.

Michael Clarke Duncan

Date: 2007

Actor Michael Clarke Duncan, best known for his role as John Coffey in The Green Mile, visited Providenciales to attend the Turks and Caicos Film Festival in 2007.

© Football.ua / CC BY-SA 3.0

Lionel Messi

Date: 2015

The Argentine professional footballer who plays for FC Barcelona stayed at the all-inclusive Beaches Turks & Caicos.

Sarah Jessica Parker

Date: 2015

The actress visited Providenciales with her husband, actor Matthew Broderick, and her three children, spotting JoJo the dolphin and lounging on Grace Bay Beach.

Matthew Broderick

Date: 2015

Matthew Broderick, who played Ferris in Ferris Bueller’s Day Off, vacationed with his wife Sarah Jessica Parker and his children in Providenciales.

© WBNX-TV 55 / CC BY 3.0

Wiz Khalifa

Date: 2015

Rapper Wiz Khalifa visited Providenciales in 2015, snapping a photo at a resort on The Bight Beach. He raps about Turks and Caicos in his song Flight to China.

© Bollywood Hungama / CC BY 3.0

Snoop Dogg

Date: 2015

Snoop Dogg visited Providenciales to attend a wedding (rapper Wiz Khalifa was also a guest).

© David Shankbone / CC BY 3.0

Katie Couric

Several visits

New anchor and author Katie Couric is known to have made quite a few trips to Providenciales and the brilliant Grace Bay Beach.

© Staff Sgt. Tony Foster / Public Domain

Chuck Norris

Several rumored visits

Actor and martial artist Chuck Norris reportedly visited the islands and was spotted exploring Little Water Cay (Iguana Island).

© Gage Skidmore / CC BY-SA 3.0

Conan O'Brien

Date: 2008

Conan O'Brien stayed on Providenciales and Grace Bay Beach.

© Georges Biard / CC BY-SA 3.0

Robin Wright

Date: 2017

Robin Wright, famous for her roles in the Princess Bride and television series House of Cards, stayed at Babalua Beach west of Grace Bay.

© Michael W. Pendergrass

Jimmy Buffett

Several visits

Along with having one of his namesake Margaritaville restaurants at the Grand Turk Cruise Center, Jimmy Buffett has stopped over at Providenciales on the Hemisphere Dancer, his signature 1955 Grumman Albatross amphibious airplane.

© ABC Television

Dick Clark

Owned a home

Dick Clark once owned a house at Taylor Bay in Chalk Sound, Providenciales.

© Jen Keys

Beyoncé

Date: 2008

Beyonce and Jay Z visited Providenciales and stayed at the Nicki Beach Resort (now Blue Haven).

© Joella Marano-Jorgebarrios / CC BY-SA 3.0

Jay Z

Date: 2008

Beyonce and Jay Z visited Providenciales and stay at the Nicki Beach Resort (now Blue Haven).

© The Come Up Show / CC BY-SA 2.0

Drake

Several visits

Drake stayed at an expansive villa at the beautiful Leeward Beach on the eastern side of Grace Bay in 2019, and has visited several times since.

© Glenn Francis / CC BY-SA 4.0

Heidi Klum

Date: 2017

In 2017, Heidi Klum stayed at Gansevoort Resort (now Wymara Resort) at the Bight Beach on the western side of Grace Bay.

© Arthur / CC BY-SA 2.0

Sean ‘P-Diddy' Combs

Date: 2020

In 2020, Sean ‘P-Diddy' Combs celebrated his 51st birthday at Hawksbill Villa in Leeward, Providenciales.

© Meghan Roberts / CC BY 2.0

DJ Khaled

Date: 2020

In September 2020, DJ Khaled (Khaled Mohamed Khaled) stayed at a private villa in Providenciales.

© Erik Drost / CC BY-SA 2.0

Jack Harlow

Date: 2023

Jack Harlow, the American rapper and actor, visited along with Drake in 2023.

© Cosmopolitan UK / CC BY-SA 3.0

Camila Cabello

Date: 2023

The singer was spotted jet skiing with rapper Drake at one of his favorite local haunts, Noah's Ark.

© Gage Skidmore / CC BY-SA 2.0

Jason Aldean

Several visits

American country music star Jason Aldean visits Providenciales often, staying at his large Leeward home. The Big Green Tractor singer and his family have explored Noah's Ark, Fort George Cay, and the La Famille Express shipwreck.

Peter Benchley

Date: 1970s

Peter Benchley, the famous author of Jaws, visited Providenciales and stayed at the historic Third Turtle Inn in Turtle Cove. He was also the author of The Island, a modern-day pirate story that actually takes place in the Turks and Caicos.

Amanyara Resort, Providenciales

The exclusive and secluded all-inclusive Amanyara Resort is located on Malcolm's Road Beach on the Northwest Point Marine National Park. This wild and scenic region of Providenciales is a perfect backdrop for a tranquil stay.

© Gage Skidmore / CC BY-SA 3.0

Will Smith

Several visits

Will Smith has stayed at several different spots on Providenciales, including on Grace Bay Beach and the remote Amanyara Resort.

© DoD News / CC BY-SA 2.0

Brad Pitt

Date: 2016

Brad Pitt spent Thanksgiving 2016 at the secluded Amanyara Resort at Malcolm Road’s Beach on Providenciales.

© Keith Allison / CC BY-SA 2.0

LeBron James

Date: 2014

LeBron James and his family visited Providenciales in 2014 and stayed at Amanyara.

© gdcgraphics / CC BY-SA 2.0

Bill Nighy

Date: 2014

Bill Nighy stared as Johnny Worricker in the political thriller Turks and Caicos, shot on Providenciales at Amanyara Resort, Blue Hills and Long Bay Beach.

© Piccolo Missionario / CC BY-SA 2.0

Winona Ryder

Date: 2014

Winona Ryder played a part in the 2014 film Turks and Caicos shot at Amanyara.

© Siebbi-César / CC BY 3.0

Helena Bonham Carter

Date: 2014

Helena Bonham Carter was another one of the famous actors that played a part in the 2014 Turks and Caicos movie.

© Eva Rinaldi / CC BY-SA 2.0

Kim Kardashian

Date: 2018

Kim Kardashian stayed at the remote and exclusive Amanyara Resort at the Northwest Point Marine National Park on Providenciales.

© Brian Minkoff / CC BY-SA 3.0

David Beckham

Date: 2017

David and Victoria Beckham and his family visited the Turks and Caicos in late December 2017.

© Eva Rinaldi / CC BY-SA 2.0

Zac Efron

2008

Zac Efron of the High School Musical movie series and Vanessa Hudgens stayed in the Turks and Caicos in 2008.

© MTV / CC BY-SA 3.0

Vanessa Hudgens

2008

Vanessa Hudgens and Zac Efron stayed at Amanyara in 2008.

© Albert Domasin / CC BY-SA 2.0

Courteney Cox

2014

Courteney Cox of the famous Friends sitcom series stayed at the exclusive resort in 2014.

© Junta de Andalucía / CC BY-SA 2.0

Shakira

2023

Colombian pop star Shakira enjoyed a holiday to Turks and Caicos in 2023. She stayed at Amanyara on a previous trip to the island.

Long Bay Beach, Providenciales

Found on the southeast side of Providenciales, Long Bay Beach is one of the region’s top kiteboarding spots, and attracts kiters from all over the globe. Luxury vacation villas can be seen across this 3-mile coast.

© Eva Rinaldi / CC BY 2.0

Nicki Minaj

Date: 2016

For her 34th birthday, Nicki Minaj stayed in a luxury beachfront villa on Long Bay Beach, Providenciales.

© Marc Zapanta / CC BY-SA 3.0

Kylie Jenner

Date: 2016

Kylie Jenner celebrated her 19th birthday at The Pearls of Long Bay luxury villa on Providenciales.

© U.S. Department of State

John Kerry

Date: 2014

Former U.S. Secretary of State John F Kerry visited the Turks and Caicos in 2014, and took kiteboarding lessons at Long Bay Beach, Providenciales.

© Glenn Francis / CC BY-SA 3.0

Kourtney Kardashian

Date: 2019

The Kardashian sisters stayed at a luxury villa on Long Bay Beach on Providenciales.

© Luke Ford / CC BY-SA 2.5

Khloe Kardashian

Date: 2019

Kourtney and Khloe Kardashian vacationed at a villa on Long Bay Beach in July of 2019.

Turtle Tail, Providenciales

Turtle Tail is a highly scenic residential area on the south coast of Providenciales. The beautiful hills and bluffs on this peninsula offer incredible views over the turquoise Caicos Banks and inland marine ponds.

Several beautiful yet small beaches are found interspersed along this limestone coast.

© penner / CC BY-SA 3.0

Prince

Owned Home

Prince owned one of the largest mansions in the Turks and Caicos, complete with a purple driveway!

© Eva Rinaldi / CC BY-SA 2.0

Rihanna

Date: 2016

Famous Bajan singer Rihanna stayed at an opulent and expansive villa in Turtle Tail, Providenciales.

© Gage Skidmore / CC BY-SA 2.0

Olivia Munn

Date: 2019

Oliva Munn visited the Turks and Caicos several times, and in July of 2019 stayed at one of the expansive villas at Turtle Tail on Providenciales.

Simone Biles

Date: 2022

Simone Biles visited the Turks and Caicos for her birthday and stayed at Prince’s former house in Turtle Tail.

© Andrew Henkelman / CC BY-SA 4.0

Naomi Osaka

Date: 2020

Naomi Osaka, who has been ranked No. 1 by the Women’s Tennis Association, visited Providenciales with her sister and stayed at a luxury villa.

Parrot Cay

The 1000-acre (405 hectare) Parrot Cay is found east of Providenciales. The island boasts spectacular beaches and luxury low-density development. Unlike the neighboring Pine Cay, Parrot Cay does not have an airstrip, so visitors are ferried to the island by boat.

The island is home to the COMO Parrot Cay Resort, luxury villas managed by the resort, and private residences. The resort also features Shambhala Retreat, the famous full-service spa and well-being center. Quite a few celebrities own homes or real estate on this tranquil cay.

© The White House

President Bill Clinton

Date: 2011

Former U.S. President Bill Clinton visited Parrot Cay and stayed at Donna Karan’s private villa.

© U.S. Department of State

Hillary Clinton

Date: 2011

Former U.S. Secretary of State Hillary Clinton visited Parrot Cay with her husband Bill and daughter Chelsea.

© Gage Skidmore / CC BY-SA 3.0

Ben Affleck and Jennifer Garner

Several visits

Ben Affleck and Jennifer Garner were married on the exclusive Parrot Cay in 2005.

© DFID

Bill and Melinda Gates

Date: 2009

Tech billionaire Bill Gates and his wife visited the Turks and Caicos in 2009. During his stay, he visited the Royal Turks and Caicos Golf Club several times.

© Rubenstein / CC BY-SA 2.0

Christie Brinkley

Owns home

Christie Brinkley owns a luxury villa, Lucky House, on Parrot Cay.

© David Shankbone / CC BY-SA 3.0

Donna Karan

Owns home

Fashion designer Donna Karan has been a long time property owner in the Turks and Caicos.

© Gage Skidmore / CC BY-SA 2.0

Bruce Willis

Owns home

Actor Bruce Willis owned one of the more luxurious villas on Parrot Cay for years, in addition to real estate on Ambergris Cay.

© Dina Regine / CC BY-SA 2.0

Keith Richards

Owns home

Rolling Stones guitarist Keith Richards owns a villa on the exclusive Parrot Cay.

© Georges Biard / CC BY-SA 3.0

Michael Douglas

Date: 2007

Actor Michael Douglas visited the Turks and Caicos in 2007 with Catherine-Zeta Jones, and was rumored to have considered purchasing property on Dellis Cay. However, the project fell through due to the 2008 financial crisis.

© David Shankbone / CC BY-SA 2.0

Demi Moore

Date: 2011

Demi Moore and Ashton Kutcher stayed on Parrot Cay at Bruce Willis’s villa.

© David Shankbone / CC BY-SA 2.0

Ashton Kutcher

Date: 2011

Demi Moore and Ashton Kutcher stayed on Parrot Cay at Bruce Willis’s villa.

© Northern Ireland Office / CC BY-SA 2.0

Prince Edward

Date: 2001 and 2023

Prince Edward, Duke of Edinburgh, visited Parrot Cay on holiday in 2001, and in 2023 as part of a royal visit.

© FCDO / OGL 3

Sophie, Duchess of Edinburgh

Date: 2001 and 2023

Sophie, Duchess of Edinburgh, visited Parrot Cay on holiday in 2001, and in 2023 as part of a royal visit.

© Ibsan73 / CC BY 2.0

Cindy Crawford

Several visits

Cindy Crawford lists Parrot Cay Beach as her favorite beach.

© Lou Stejskal / CC BY-SA 2.0

Justin Bieber

Date: 2015

Justin Bieber stayed at Christie Brinkley’s Lucky House on Parrot Cay.

© DoD News / CC BY-SA 2.0

Brad Pitt

Date: 2012

Brad Pitt, Angelina Jolie and family stayed at Donna Karan’s villa.

© FCO

Angelina Jolie

Date: 2012

Brad Pitt, Angelina Jolie and family stayed at Donna Karan’s villa.

© Gage Skidmore / CC BY-SA 3.0

Cara Delevingne

Date: 2015

English supermodel Cara Delevingne lists Parrot Cay as her favorite island in the world.

Barbra Streisand

Date: 2000

Barbra Streisand spent Christmas at the island.

© Neil Grabowsky / Montclair Film Festival / CC BY 2.0

Richard Gere

Date:

Richard Gere stayed on Parrot Cay, and also played at the Royal Turks and Caicos Golf Club.

© Toglenn / CC BY-SA 3.0

Gene Simmons

Date: 2007

Gene Simmons spent some time on Parrot Cay and filmed part of a Family Jewels episode here as well.

© Bill Norton / CC BY-SA 2.0

Howard Stern

Date: 2010

Howard Stern’s stay on Parrot Cay was apparently marred by migrating swarms of termites! This rare and localized event can be seen at times throughout the country.

© David Shankbone / CC BY-SA 3.0

Jerry Seinfeld

Date: 2000

Jerry Seinfeld honeymooned on the island with wife Jessica.

© Georges Biard / CC BY-SA 3.0

Liam Neeson

Date: 2000

Liam Neeson and his late wife Natasha Richardson stayed at Parrot Cay in 2000.

© Georges Biard / CC BY-SA 3.0

Eva Longoria

Date: 2007

Eva Longoria stayed on Parrot Cay for her honeymoon with Tony Parker in 2007.

© Walterlan Papetti / CC BY-SA 4.0

Rio Ferdinand

Home

Professional footballer Rio Ferdinand owns a villa on Parrot Cay.

© Nicolas Genin / CC BY-SA 2.0

Matt Damon

Several visits

Matt Damon has made several trips to the Turks and Caicos with his friend Ben Affleck.

© Georges Biard / CC BY-SA 3.0

Julia Roberts

Several visits

Actress Julia Roberts has been known to visit the private island several times.

© Deon Maritz / CC BY-SA 2.0

Kate Moss

Several visits

British supermodel Kate Moss has made quite a few trips to the beautiful Turks and Caicos Islands, and has done modeling work here as well.

© Rich Esteban / CC BY-SA 4.0

Janet Jackson

Date: 2001

Janet Jackson made a quick trip to Parrot Cay in 2001.

© Andrea Raffin / CC BY-SA 3.0

Gwyneth Paltrow

Several visits

Gwyneth Paltrow has visited the Turks and Caicos and Parrot Cay a few times, and owns land on Ambergris Cay.

© Glenn Francis / CC BY-SA 4.0

Taylor Swift

2017

Taylor Swift visited Parrot Cay in the Turks and Caicos with boyfriend Joe Alwyn in 2017.

© iDominick / CC BY-SA 2.0

Sofía Vergara

2016

Sofía Vergara, of sitcom Modern Family, stayed at Parrot Cay in September of 2016.

© Phil Fieldman / CC BY-SA 4.0

Mel B

2016

Melanie Janine Brown, aka Scary Spice of the Spice Girls, visited the Turks and Caicos in 2016.

© Georges Biard / CC BY-SA 3.0

Brooke Shields

2023

In 2023, Brooke Shields vacationed on Parrot Cay with her daughters and husband and went parasailing.

South Caicos

South Caicos is the last of the Caicos islands east of Providenciales, and is considered to be the nation’s fishing capital. South Caicos has a generally laid-back atmosphere.

New developments, such as Sailrock Resort, are catering to a high-end of tourist wanting seclusion and privacy.

© LG / CC BY-SA 3.0

Neil Patrick Harris

Visited 2017

Neil Patrick Harris, of How I Met Your Mother and Doogie Howser, M.D. fame, stayed at Sailrock in 2017.

© Stefan Brending / CC BY-SA 3.0

Lindsey Vonn

Visited 2017

Lindsey Vonn, the first American to win the gold medal in downhill skiing at the 2010 Winter Olympics, stayed at Sailrock in 2017.

© Mingle Media TV / CC BY-SA 3.0

Ansel Elgort

Visited 2018

Ansel Elgort, known for his role in The Divergent Series and Baby Driver vacationed at Sailrock in 2018.

Public Domain

Jacques Mayol

Lived in Bell Sound

The famous French diving legend and holder of many world records in free diving lived in Bell Sound, South Caicos.
